title: Setting up a Hub
text: first step setting Modeling Hub make copy hubTemplate GitHub template repository clone local copy .

title: Setting up a Hub
text: Hubs configured two JSON config files used validate new submissions well inform data users available data. admin.json: Contains Hub wide administrative configuration settings tasks.json: Contains round-specific metadata modeling tasks including task, target output type metadata well details submission windows. files live directory called hub-config/ root Hub repository. details files, guidance set access templates, please see central hubDocs well JSON schema config files adhere .

title: Setting up a Hub
text: can use function validate_config() check whether Hub config files valid. specify file want validate can either provide path root Hub argument hub_path (assumes config files correctly located directory hub-config/) can provide direct path config file argument config_path. also need specify type config file argument config (one "tasks" "admin", defaults "tasks"). function validate given config file specific version ’s schema, specified argument schema_version. default value schema_version "from_config" uses version specified schema_version property config file validated. validation succeeds, function returns TRUE. path config file validated version URL schema used validation also attached attributes "config_path", "schema_version" "schema_url" respectively. can validate config file latest version schema using "latest" can choose specific version, e.g "v0.0.1". function defaults using stable schema versions released main branch, can choose validate another branch (e.g. upcoming development version) argument branch.

title: Setting up a Hub
text: validation config file fails, function returns FALSE. additional list dataframe errors returned ajv validation engine used also attached attribute "errors". default output validator can unwieldy difficult review, function also prints user friendly concise version errors table. rounds └1 └─model_tasks └──1 └───task_ids └────target └─────required properties └rounds └─items └──properties └───model_tasks └────items └─────properties └──────task_ids └───────properties └────────target └─────────properties └──────────required └───────────type array, null rounds └1 └─model_tasks └──1 └───output_type └────mean └─────type_id properties └rounds └─items └──properties └───model_tasks └────items └─────properties └──────output_type └───────properties └────────mean └─────────properties └──────────type_id └───────────oneOf 1 required-description: mean required, property set single element 'NA' array required-type: array required-items-const:'NA' required-items-maxItems: 1 optional-description: mean required, property set null optional-type: null 2 required-description: mean optional, property set null required-type: null optional-description: mean optional, property set single element 'NA' array optional-type: array optional-items-const:'NA' optional-items-maxItems: 1 rounds └1 └─submissions_due properties └rounds └─items └──properties └───submissions_due └────oneOf 1 relative_to-description: Name task id variable relation submission start end dates calculated. relative_to-type: string start-description: Difference days start origin date. start-type: integer start-format:'NA' end-description: Difference days end origin date. end-type: integer end-format:'NA' required1: relative_to required2: start required3: end 2 relative_to-description:'NA' relative_to-type:'NA' start-description: Submission start date. start-type: string start-format: date end-description: Submission end date. end-type: string end-format: date required1: start required2: end example : instancePath indicates location validation error config file. schemaPath indicates location element schema failing validation. keyword indicates keyword causing validation error. message validation error message returned validator. schema describes valid schema values failing keyword conform . data value property config file failing validation. can suppress printing pretty errors table pretty_errors = FALSE.

what: Utility functions for Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs
title: Utility functions for Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs
text: goal hubUtils provide set utility functions downloading, plotting, scoring forecast truth data Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs

title: Utility functions for Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs
text: can install development version hubUtils like :
code: remotes::install_github("Infectious-Disease-Modeling-Hubs/hubUtils")

what: Connect to a Modeling Hub — connect_hub
title: Connect to a Modeling Hub — connect_hub
text: Connect Modeling Hub

title: Connect to a Modeling Hub — connect_hub
code: connect_hub(   hub_path,   hubmeta_path = NULL,   hubmeta_format = c("json", "yaml", "yml") )

title: Connect to a Modeling Hub — connect_hub
text: hub_path Path Modeling Hub directory. hubmeta_path Path hubmeta file. default (NULL) expects file root directory given hub_path named hubmeta accepted file format (see hubmeta_format). Use argument hubmeta file non-default location non-default file name include file extension path. hubmeta_format file extension hubmeta file. One "json", "yaml" "yml". Defaults "json" ignored hubmeta_path provided.

title: Connect to a Modeling Hub — connect_hub
text: S3 object class <hub-connection> containing metadata modeling hub. object used communicate Modelling Hub extracting submitting data.

title: Connect to a Modeling Hub — connect_hub
code: # Simple forecasting Hub example hub_path <- system.file("hub_1", package = "hubUtils") connect_hub(hub_path) #>  #> ── <hub_connection> ── #>  #> ℹ Connected to Hub at /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/hubUtils/hub_1 #> ℹ Connection configured using hubmeta file #>   /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/hubUtils/hub_1/hubmeta.json #> • task_ids_by_round: FALSE # Scenario Hub example scnr_path <- system.file("scnr_hub_1", package = "hubUtils") connect_hub(hub_path) #>  #> ── <hub_connection> ── #>  #> ℹ Connected to Hub at /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/hubUtils/hub_1 #> ℹ Connection configured using hubmeta file #>   /home/runner/work/_temp/Library/hubUtils/hub_1/hubmeta.json #> • task_ids_by_round: FALSE

title: Get round ids — get_round_ids
text: Get round ids

title: Get round ids — get_round_ids
code: get_round_ids(con)

title: Get round ids — get_round_ids
text: con hub_connection class object.

title: Get round ids — get_round_ids
text: character vector round ids.

title: Get round ids — get_round_ids
code: con <- connect_hub(system.file("hub_1", package = "hubUtils")) get_round_ids(con) #> [1] "origin_date" con <- connect_hub(system.file("scnr_hub_1", package = "hubUtils")) get_round_ids(con) #> [1] "round-1" "round-2"

title: Validate a hub config file against a Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs schema — validate_config
text: hub_path Path local hub directory. config Name config file validate. One "tasks" "admin". config_path Defaults NULL assumes config files hub-config directory root hub directory. Argument config_path can used override default providing path config file validated. schema_version Character string specifying json schema version used validation. default value "from_config" use version specified schema_version property config file. "latest" use latest version available Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs schemas repository. Alternartively, specific version schema (e.g. "v0.0.1")  can specified. branch branch Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs schemas repository fetch schema. Defaults "main". pretty_errors Whether launch informative pretty table validation errors Viewer panel. Defaults TRUE.

title: Validate a hub config file against a Infectious Disease Modeling Hubs schema — validate_config
text: Returns result validation. validation successful, return TRUE. validation errors detected, returns FALSE details errors appended data.frame errors attribute. access errors table use attr(x, "errors") x output function.
